Title: Apologise, calling Tinubu ‘criminal’ unacceptable, Igbokwe tells Sowore
Summary: Sahara Reporters publisher Omoyele Sowore called President Bola Ahmed Tinubu a criminal . Joe Igbokwe, a chieftain of the All Progressives Congress (APC) has called on SaharaReporters publisher to retract and apologise for his remarks .

Title: My 10 kobo advice to Sowore
Summary: I advised him to withdraw the shameful, scurrilous drivels and apologise to the President . I got to know Sowore through his good friend, Mr Peter Claver . He has not found the need to apologise to Nigerians who elected him as president .

Title: Terror won’t win, Shettima assures Borno after deadly attack
Summary: Vice President Kashim Shettima has vowed that Nigeria will not bow to terror . He condoled with the people of Borno State over the deadly attack on Darajamal community in the Bama Local Government Area .

Title: REDMI 15C: The Must-Have Xiaomi Smartphone This September

Title: World Igbo Congress USA Convention raised posers
Summary: World Igbo Congress (WIC), the umbrella body of all Igbo in the diaspora (residing abroad) rose from its 2025 annual convention held in Quincy, Massachusetts . The three-day meeting themed “KOKOROKOOO: Igbo’s”

Title: BRICS: South Africa becomes UAE’s 2nd-largest non-oil trade partner in Africa
Summary: Thani bin Ahmed Al Zeyoudi, the UAE Minister of Foreign Trade, met with representatives of the South African Business Council in the UAE to discuss opportunities for expanding trade, investment, and private sector collaboration .

Title: Dangote Refinery: PENGASSAN backs NUPENG, issues strike threat
Summary: PENGASSAN has declared solidarity with NUPENG and threatened to join in shutting down the refinery operations if the company continues to resist unionisation . The industrial dispute between the Nigeria Union of Petroleum and Natural Gas Workers, NUPeng, and the Dangote Refinery has taken a new turn .
